review: Unless you're going to go for the very top of the line most expensive professional chords, these will do for any medium sized venue.
These work just like you want them to.  But a new strap and put these on right away.  It's worth it.
I use these with Ernie Ball regular slinkies.  I find that if you stay right in the middle then you can play a very wide variety of styles.  It's also cheaper.
I really like the mediums.  They are able to play the biggest variety of styles without being too heavy or not durable enough.
A little nicer than I thought it would be. As far as inexpensive straps go this one is worth it.  I like the pick pocket too.  But don't let the pocket be the selling point.  It's not that cool.
Not very bright. Not very flexible. Too big. Clunky. I really don't like it. I wish I had went in a different direction.
Comes in a really nice case.  Works great.  Great price. Very light.  Can't speak to durability because haven't had them long and haven't used them heavily.
It's not an entire bridge assembly but it's exactly what I needed. In my opinion it is worth the money.
They're round and they fit over microphones.  Work well to stop pops and lisps.  Have been very happy with them.
I really like the mediums.  They are able to play the biggest variety of styles without being to heavy or not durable enough.
I've been using this product for a while now.  Only for indoor really light use.  So I can't speak to it's durability at this time. But I like it because it's cheap, light, and it works.
Unless you're going to get a very expensive professional chord this is just as good as any other and works great for medium sized venues.
I don't use it for any heavy use.  I use it for podcasting purposes.  Haven't had any problems.  So I can't speak to really heavy use of the product.
